text: Dee Tails is an English rapper, dancer and actor/creature performer best known for his work in the British boy band MN8, Star Wars: The Force Awakens, Rogue One, Star Wars: The Last Jedi, and Solo: A Star Wars Story. ==Career== Dee Tails started his career as a member of the R&B; group MN8 where he achieved 7 top 25 hit singles in the UK and international success in France, Australia, New Zealand and the US. Their debut single "I've Got a Little Something for You" featured on the Bad Boys soundtrack and was notably one of the first ever remixes by P.Diddy for his Bad Boy label. MN8 also supported Janet Jackson on the European leg of her tour in 1995. After MN8, Dee Tails focused on his acting career where he did theatre work for many years playing Tommy the Cat in Dick Whittington, quoted by The Stage as a "a real standout performance". He also had a feature role in Batman Begins as a Gotham City Police Officer in 2005. In 2013, he appeared in the film Captain Phillips as a UKMTO Operator. In 2015, he appeared in 4 episodes of Jekyll & Hyde for ITV where he played The Harbinger alongside Richard E. Grant. In 2004, he appeared as a mystery guest on the identity parade on Never Mind the Buzzcocks. Dee Tails also featured as a leading role in a Nescafe commercial in 2011, filmed in South Africa which featured Dee Tails alongside a piano in the commercial. In 2015, Dee Tails landed the role of Cratinus in Star Wars: The Force Awakens. He then went on to perform as the character L-1 (also known as K-Ohn) in Rogue One: A Star Wars Story in 2016. In 2017, he played the role of Slowen Lo in Star Wars: The Last Jedi voiced by Joseph Gordon-Levitt. In 2018, Tails played Quay Tolsite in the film Solo: A Star Wars Story. ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year !! Title !!
